rrr
  • Reference
  • Articles

Fit Reduced-Rank Regression Model

rrr fits a reduced-rank regression model.

rrr(x, y, gamma_matrix, rank = "full", type = "cov", k = 0)

Arguments

x
data frame or matrix of input variables
y
data frame or matrix of response variables
gamma_matrix
weight matrix
rank
of the coefficient matrix to estimate. Default rank = full prodcues the standard multivariate regression technique.
type
the format of the covariance matrix. type = "cov" runs the regression using the mean-centered covariance matrix. type = "cor" runs the regression using the mean-centered, standard-deviation-scaled correlation matrix.
k
small number to add to the ridge.

References

Izenman, A.J. (2008) Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer.

Examples

data(tobacco)
tobacco_x <- tobacco[,1:3]
tobacco_y <- tobacco[,4:9]
gamma <- diag(1, dim(tobacco_y)[2])
rrr(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma, rank = 1)
#> $mean
#>           [,1]
#> [1,] 1.5776447
#> [2,] 3.7140605
#> [3,] 2.1372794
#> [4,] 0.5228983
